benchmark_details.name: PAP2PAT (Patent-Paper Pairs)
benchmark_details.overview: PAP2PAT is an open and realistic benchmark for patent drafting consisting of 1.8k patent-paper pairs describing the same inventions, aimed at evaluating long-document generation tasks for LLMs.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate and facilitate the generation of patent applications using large language models by providing a standard benchmark with matched patent-paper pairs.

data.source: 1.8k matched Patent-Paper Pairs from USPTO dataset and SemOpenAlex.
data.annotation: Manual annotation and validation of matches between patents and research papers.

methodology.calculation: Automatic evaluation metrics adapted for long documents assessing factual consistency, coverage of content, and stylistic similarity.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better factual correctness and adherence to patent language style.
methodology.validation: Manual validation of matching process and benchmark performance through human evaluations.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Released under permissive licenses allowing redistribution and commercial use.
